title: URGENT (In-Client) REWORK EVE BUG THAT NEEDS TO BE FIXED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

embed.description: Uploaded by Little Witch Eve on 2017-10-10.

replies.body: These videos are usually updated after every region has finished patching. OCE is the first region to patch so it may take a little while for these videos to update.

> [{quoted}](name=Gehirn,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=dM0VYkAj,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-11T02:56:31.522+0000)
>
> These videos are usually updated after every region has finished patching. OCE is the first region to patch so it may take a little while for these videos to update.

HI Rioter,

Whats the 'difference' in patch update times? 
You say OCE is updated/patched first, but whose like 2nd and last? 
Does that just depend on the time zone of the region?

Hey Purplerain,

The difference is usually 1-3 hours as its rolled out, and it mostly follows timezones so JP is patched right after OCE.

> [{quoted}](name=Gehirn,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=dM0VYkAj,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-13T06:43:37.316+0000)
>
> Hey Purplerain,
> 
> The difference is usually 1-3 hours as its rolled out, and it mostly follows timezones so JP is patched right after OCE.

Thanks for this, I thought it would be much longer. 

This seems like a 'google it' kinda question, but do all the regions get the new patch on the same day? 

eg. 13/10/17 a new patch is rolled out, but regions, where the time zone difference is like 12 hours to OCE, don't wait the 12 hours? 

Is it just the 1-3 hours like you stated?
It takes about 20 hours to patch all the Riot regions, the 1-3 hours difference is per region as the patch rolls out.
Lol? That always happens whenever an old champ is updated, obviously you wouldn't know that if you don't play any other champions.
I have no reason to. Eve is life.
